Former Indian, now American here. You missed a big caveat. 
1. The gun problem in America has no connection with global weapons industry. Lockheed Martin isn’t selling guns to the American people. 
2. Gun ownership in the United States is protected by the constitution under the 2nd Amendment. It is a very fundamental part of being an American. Australia’s approach will simply not work.
I cannot stress this enough domestic gun laws of the United States has nothing to do with international weapons industry. In fact, American citizens cannot own fighter jets or weapon systems used in wars.
The two are completely unrelated.

This is the reason why majority of Americans aren’t going to every let there be a gun ban.

There are two types of people, each with their own perspective on the world. 

The first type longs to hear the raw and painful truth, no matter how much it may hurt. They seek understanding, even if it means facing the harsh realities of life. These individuals yearn for honesty, craving the unfiltered revelations that can shake their very core. 

But then there is the second type, those who prefer to shield themselves from the cold embrace of reality. They cling to their beliefs, seeking solace in a comforting illusion. They turn a blind eye to the truths that may shatter their carefully constructed world, afraid of the vulnerability that comes with acknowledging the harshness of existence. 

It is a heartbreaking reality that these two types of people often clash. The seekers of truth desperately try to open the eyes of the believers, hoping to bridge the gap between their differing perceptions. Yet, their efforts often go in vain, as the believers remain steadfast in their chosen ignorance.

Sorry to break it to you, Dhruv, but banning guns isn't going to stop gun violence. Just as outlawing drugs hasn't stemmed the tide of illegal drugs at all, taking legal guns out of the hands of law-abiding citizens isn't going to stop criminals from getting guns and using them. In the US, the court systems have even ruled that the police do not have a duty to defend citizens; that responsibility stays in the hands of those citizens. Unfortunately, in many states in the US, citizens are prevented from defending themselves, with predictable outcomes.

There are hundreds of millions of privately-owned guns in the US, and more than a trillion rounds of privately-owned ammunition. More than any army on earth. If private gun owners really were a problem, the world would know it. Instead, the American government's own statistics, collected by the FBI, paint a much different picture: If just 5 specific US cities are excluded from the gun violence statistics, the US drops from its current high position down to third from the bottom among all nations in the world. If you were to exclude maybe one or two more cities, the US would probably be right at the bottom. Those cities have a very distinct ethnic makeup. The problem isn't the guns, it's the people wielding them.

On top of that, the history of countries that have banned all firearms is sobering. Typically within a decade after banning private ownership of firearms and confiscating them, you will see a genocide, or takeover by dictatorship, or some similar humanitarian disaster. Depriving private citizens of a means of defense invariably results in tyranny in one form or another.

During the Bronze age, ancient Israel along with other Levantine nations we're invaded by a proto-Greek people. The ancient Egyptians called them “the sea people” because they invaded via the ocean. The Israelis simply called them “Plishtim” or “Philistines” in English, coming from the Hebrew word “Palash” meaning “to invade”, and “Plishtim” meaning “Invaders"

And after putting down a series of Jewish revolts in Israel, the Romans, as a way to insult them, renamed their land from “Provincia-Judea” to “Provincia-Palestina” essentially naming their land after their old hated enemies.

From that point on, “Palestina” or “Palestine” in English became the standard term for the territory used by foreign Colonialist.

More than 75 years ago, the state of Israel shocked the world when it seized the remaining 🇵🇸 Palestinian territories of the West Bank, East Jerusalem, Gaza Strip, as well as the Syrian Golan Heights and the Egyptian Sinai Peninsula, in a matter of six days.

In a war with Egypt, Jordan and Syria, known as the 1967 War, or the June War, Israel delivered what came to be known as the “Naksa”, meaning setback or defeat, to the armies of the neighbouring Arab countries, and to the Palestinians who lost all what remained of their homeland The Naksa was a continuation of a prior central event that paved the way for the 1967 war. Nineteen years earlier, in 1948, the state of Israel came into being in a violent process that entailed the ethnic cleansing of Palestine.
Zionist forces, in their mission to create a "Jewish state", expelled some 750,000 Palestinians from their homeland and destroyed their villages in the process.

Shortly after Israel declared state- hood, units of the neighbouring Arab country armies came in to fight for the Palestinian nation.

Here are some facts. Some facts about the Israel Vs Palestine situation should be pointed out: (1) There was never a state called Palestine. It was an area that was under the Ottoman Empire before the British took control of the land. These people are culturally the same as Lebanese or Jordanians. The consciousness of Arabs living there as Palestinian nation is of very recent origin (2nd half of 20th century.) (2) Israel was created after the second world war to bring back the Jews to their ancient land. Although, some Jews always remained there. (3) Right from the point when Israel was created the Arab countries attacked them. The war was eventually won by Israel. (4) Similarly, the Israelis fought wars in 1967 and 1973 against the Arabs. In 1967, Israel captured the Sinai Peninsula from Egypt and some more land in Palestine. It returned back the Sinai Peninsula to Egypt in a peace deal after the 1973 war. Israel didn't return the captured Palestinian land since no peace deal could be brokered with them. (5) Palestinians have been unwilling to sign any type of peace deal and have been in a constant state of war with Israel. As a bargaining chip Israel keeps capturing additional land in every such failed assault of the Palestinians. Indeed, in an apparent peace effort brokered by the US, in 2005, the Israelis vacated Gaza leaving the land for exclusive use of Gazans. But instead of taking the path of progress they took the path of terrorism. (6) Hamas was elected by the Palestinians and it has dictatorial control over Gaza. It shoots missiles on Israel on a daily basis. (7) On 7 October, 2023, Hamas invaded Israel and massacred some 1400 Israelis and abducted about 240 of them. They used GoPro cams to film their acts of terrorism and showed it to the Gazans who were cheering these acts of barbarism. (8) Hamas has deliberately embedded itself under the civilian infrastructure like Schools, Hospitals, Mosques and Churches. (9) Israel has been warning the Palestinians to vacate the the Northern Gaza since the war began but Hamas has been preventing them from moving south and using them as human shields. It has also been using the inevitable civilian casualties for their propaganda. (10) If the Islamists were powerful, they would be as merciless as they were in the initial 300 years of Islamic expansion. They would do the same to the Israelis as their Prophet had done to the Jews of his time in Arabia. These religious maniacs would do the same to the world as they had done to the Christian Byzantines. Indeed, the Hamas preamble to their charter of 1988 states “Israel will exist and will continue to exist until Islam invalidates it, just as it invalidated others before it.” No nation should have to remain under constant attack of rocket fire from a hostile neighbour on a daily basis.
